bullets.text: Markets await Fed decision; a rate cut and balance sheet guidance are expected to shape near-term risk assets.
Japan’s Nikkei tops 51,000 for first time as Asia gauges Fed path.
Australia CPI hits 3.2%, highest in over a year, reducing odds of near-term RBA easing.
Visa results show resilient consumer spending and cross-border volumes, supporting soft-landing narrative.
UPS eliminates 48,000 roles in 2025 amid turnaround, signaling weak volumes and aggressive cost control.
Amazon to cut ~14,000 corporate jobs while ramping AI investment, rebalancing costs and priorities.
Nvidia begins manufacturing AI chips in Arizona, bolstering U.S. supply chain resilience and onshoring.
SK Hynix Q3 profit jumps 62% to record on AI memory demand; pricing power persists.
OpenAI restructures as for-profit; Microsoft becomes major shareholder, consolidating influence in foundational AI.
U.S. plans $80B in nuclear reactors; uranium supplier Cameco surges, underscoring nuclear build-out momentum.
Israel resumes Gaza strikes, alleging Hamas cease-fire violations, elevating regional geopolitical risk.
North Korea fires missile ahead of Trump’s South Korea visit, heightening security tensions.
U.S. home price gains trail inflation, eroding homeowners’ real wealth and housing’s perceived inflation hedge.
Hurricane Melissa batters Jamaica and Caribbean, causing widespread damage with significant economic and insurance impacts.
